===Etymology===
{{ja-kanjitab|ま|ほう|yomi=o}}
Apparently from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=まほう}} compound {{m|zh|魔法|tr=muɑ pjop|lit=devil, magic + law, method}}. Compare modern {{etyl|nan|-}} reading ''mô͘-hoat''.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|まほう|acc=h|acc_ref=NHK,DJR|y=go}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|まほう}}

# The [[art]]s of [[magic]], [[spellcraft]], [[witchcraft]], [[wizardry]], [[sorcery]].
# [[spellwork|Spellwork]] such as [[magical]] [[formula]]s, [[incantation]]s, [[spells]], etc.
# An [[organize]]d [[body]] or [[system]] of magical use, i.e. [[Wicca]], the [[Kabballah]] and [[陰陽道|Onmyōdō]].

====Usage notes====
The term for {{m|en|magic}} as a trick performed by a modern [[magician]] is {{ja-r|手品|てじな}}.

====Derived terms====
{{der-top|Derived terms}}
* {{ja-r|魔法師|まほうし}}, {{ja-r|魔法士|まほうし}}: magic [[master]] or [[specialist]], sorcerer
* {{ja-r|魔法円|まほうえん}}: [[magic circle]]
* {{ja-r|魔法少女|まほうしょうじょ}}: [[magical]] [[girl]]
* {{ja-r|魔法使い|まほうつかい}}: [[magician]]
* {{ja-r|魔法瓶|まほうびん}}: [[vacuum flask]]
* {{ja-r|魔法の杖|まほう の つえ}}: lit. a [[magic wand]]
{{der-bottom}}
